text: I'm using (GNU) Make in my project.
I'm currently putting one makefile per directory and specify the subdirectories using SUBDIRS.
It's been suggested to me that this is not the ideal way of using make, that using a one toplevel make file (or several, split up using include).
I've tried migrating/using this layout in the past, but it appears to me that it's unnecessary complicated.
Which are the benefits/drawbacks of using recursive makefiles?
